trans-unit.source: You can create virtual machines (VMs) in Azure and expose them to the public Internet by using a public IP address.
trans-unit.target: You can create virtual machines (VMs) in Azure and expose them to the public Internet by using a public IP address.

trans-unit.source: By default, Public IPs are dynamic and the address associated to them may change when the VM is deleted.
trans-unit.target: By default, Public IPs are dynamic and the address associated to them may change when the VM is deleted.

trans-unit.source: To guarantee that the VM always uses the same public IP address, you need to create a static Public IP.
trans-unit.target: To guarantee that the VM always uses the same public IP address, you need to create a static Public IP.

trans-unit.source: Before you can implement static Public IPs in VMs, it is necessary to understand when you can use static Public IPs, and how they are used.
trans-unit.target: Before you can implement static Public IPs in VMs, it is necessary to understand when you can use static Public IPs, and how they are used.

trans-unit.source: Read the [IP addressing overview](../articles/virtual-network/virtual-network-ip-addresses-overview-arm.md) to learn more about IP addressing in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Read the [IP addressing overview](../articles/virtual-network/virtual-network-ip-addresses-overview-arm.md) to learn more about IP addressing in Azure.
